intro: Senecio sweetii, commonly known as the sweet's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
